com.github.dm.jrt.core.config

Class InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.config.InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    TYPE - the configurable object type.
    Enclosing class:
    InvocationConfiguration

    public static final class InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
extends Object
    Builder of invocation configurations.

      • setConfiguration

        @NotNull
public TYPE setConfiguration()
        Applies this configuration and returns the configured object.
        Returns:
        the configured object.

      • with

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> with(@Nullable
                                                 InvocationConfiguration configuration)
        Applies the specified configuration to this builder. A null value means that all the configuration options will be reset to their default, otherwise only the non-default options will be applied.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the invocation configuration.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withCoreInstances

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withCoreInstances(int coreInstances)
        Sets the number of invocation instances, which represents the core pool of reusable invocations. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        coreInstances - the core number of instances.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is negative.

      • withInputLimit

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputLimit(int inputLimit)
        Sets the limit of data that the input channel can retain before starting to slow down the feeding thread. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        This configuration option is used to slow down the process feeding the routine invocation when its execution time increases. Note, however, that it is not allowed to block the invocation execution thread, so make sure that the feeding routine and this one does not share the same runner.

        Parameters:
        inputLimit - the limit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the limit is negative.

      • withInputMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputMaxDelay(long delay,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread, waiting for the input channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the input limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified delay is negative.
        See Also:
        withInputMaxSize(int)

      • withInputMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputMaxDelay(@Nullable
                                                              TimeDuration delay)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread, waiting for the input channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the input limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        withInputMaxSize(int)

      • withInputMaxSize

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputMaxSize(int inputMaxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of data that the input channel can retain before they are consumed. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        When the maximum capacity is reached, the invocation will be aborted with an InputDeadlockException.
        Parameters:
        inputMaxSize - the maximum size.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withInputOrder

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputOrder(@Nullable
                                                           InvocationConfiguration.OrderType orderType)
        Sets the order in which input data are collected from the input channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the channel order can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        orderType - the order type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withLog

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withLog(@Nullable
                                                    Log log)
        Sets the log instance. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        log - the log instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withLogLevel(@Nullable

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • withMaxInstances

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withMaxInstances(int maxInstances)
        Sets the max number of concurrently running invocation instances. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        maxInstances - the max number of instances.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withOutputLimit

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputLimit(int outputLimit)
        Sets the limit of data that the output channel can retain before starting to slow down the feeding thread. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        This configuration option is useful when the results coming from the invocation execution are meant to be explicitly read through its output channel. The execution will slow down until enough data are consumed. Note, however, that binding the channel to an output consumer might make the option ineffective.

        Parameters:
        outputLimit - the limit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the limit is negative.

      • withOutputMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputMaxDelay(long delay,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread, waiting for the result channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the output limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified delay is negative.
        See Also:
        withOutputMaxSize(int)

      • withOutputMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputMaxDelay(@Nullable
                                                               TimeDuration delay)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread, waiting for the result channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the output limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        withOutputMaxSize(int)

      • withOutputMaxSize

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputMaxSize(int outputMaxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of data that the result channel can retain before they are consumed. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        When the maximum capacity is reached, the invocation will be aborted with an InputDeadlockException.
        Parameters:
        outputMaxSize - the maximum size.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withOutputOrder

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputOrder(@Nullable
                                                            InvocationConfiguration.OrderType orderType)
        Sets the order in which output data are collected from the result channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default order one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the channel order can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        orderType - the order type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withPriority

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withPriority(int priority)
        Sets the invocation priority. A DEFAULT value means that the invocations will be executed with no specific priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        PriorityRunner

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(long timeout,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout for an invocation instance to produce a readable result.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified timeout is negative.

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(@Nullable
                                                            TimeDuration timeout)
        Sets the timeout for an invocation instance to produce a readable result. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withReadTimeoutAction

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeoutAction(@Nullable
                                                                  InvocationConfiguration.TimeoutActionType actionType)
        Sets the action to be taken if the timeout elapses before a result can be read from the output channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout action can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        actionType - the action type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withRunner

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withRunner(@Nullable
                                                       Runner runner)
        Sets the asynchronous runner instance. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        runner - the runner instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.
